entry.content:
Modern Business English : Presentation Basics

before:

Today I attended some meetings and discussed our product details with product manager ,Which made me very tired,Because I need to consider everyone who use our products ,which means you have to have a smart head and a careful heart.

topic:

  1. how to decrease our product problems

  2. how to improve bad influence by environment pollution

Vocabulary

presentation

Tom has to give a presentation at company tomorrow.

you can scout some material to make a presentation on the Internet.

audience

Many audience like to watch basketball games at the stadium

topic

Do you mind me change other topic to talk ? We already talk about perfume more than one hours.

wrap-up

Our products sale very well in the last year,so we can rest wrap-up for a few days.

outline

Please outline the product errors pointed out by our customers to facilitate later analysis of the problem.

My Chinese teacher told me that before you start writing an article, you would first understand the outline of the article in your head.

Going On A Business Trip

3/15

A1: No,I don’t, I usually select train to travel

A2: bad weather,unsatisfactory hotels,different cultures,language

A3: first ,I would make the reservation hotels and trains through the Internet. ,second,pack necessary things

4/15

overseas

Tome is fond of travel overseas when he has holiday

suite

can you help me make the reservation for a large suite

abroad

abroad always tempt many chinese

jet lag

when you have to deal with the jet lag,you may first consider about sleeping

destination

The destination is

8/15

A1: I like to buy makeup and clothes at a duty-free shop

11/15

4: time zones

12/15

travel agency

duty free

jet lag

business class

credit card

hotel suit

boarding pass

13/15

A1: No,Because I don’t have enough time to travel , my family also

A2: Because it is very convenient for trip,and you can save your energy to do more interesting things

A3: No,Because it’s a different country,I am not sure I can buy necessary things in a short time

A4: Yes,I love to sightsee in the city, the sunset always splendid
entry.summary: Going On A Bus

entry.content:
Looking For A Job

Group Discussion

A1: Yes,I work in Guangzhou city

A2: at least 8 hours every workday

A3: When I found a new way to achieve goals ,I would very happy.

​ when I waste lots time to attend unnecessary meetings

Introduction

Yes,Because work can bring money and fun to people, and people can’t live without money.

Let’s Talk About Occupations

1 –> D

2 –> E

3 –> F

4 –> C

5 –> A

6 –> B

1 –> D

2 –> C

3 –> B

4 –> A

You Tell Us

1 Doctor

2 Security

3 Nurse

4 Bank staff

5 veterinary

Can You Name These Occupations

1 waitress

2 soldier

3 nurse

Personal Qualities

energetic: They always smile on their faces.

Your Turn

  1. Police
  2. secretary

Your Dream Job

A1: My dream job is to be a physicist/scientist ,Because if I were a scientist ,I can able to do lots of things for my country. this job can gives me more responsible, it’s very interesting

A2: patient You may have to face many failures, and every small mistakes can lead to failure

​ smart You need have a great brain

​ honest Every results based on experiment results

A3: first, I need got a great scores on my university, second, When I applied to position by research institute ,I need successfully entered the research institute

Let’s review

1 punctual

2 Employee

3 qualities
entry.summary: Looking For A Job

entry.content:
Questions

A1: Yes,I do,I think one of the business laws is obey the contract content

A2: lawyer,police,detective,spy,forensic accountant

Vocabulary

The police has to investigate a new crime case as soon as possible to downing people’s furious

Tom wants to be a lawyer when he was a high school student

Jan want to celebrate the night before when she graduated from a university

spreadsheet is a very popular style to fill up some datas

The two lawyers have many different arguments on the forensic

Discussion

A1: I need to learn the professional knowledge and grasp skills about the job

A2: I am an inquisitive girl.

A3: Because the job needs a people who have excellent ability ,for example numerical skills and patience,I am afraid I am not competent.

Questions

entry.content:
Conversation

A1: I’m 25 years old

A2:I am in a busy but happy life,I must keep on studying to avoid being detached from society

A3: They are 50 years old,and They are in a enjoyable life,Because They are be surrounded with lots of interesting students

At What stage life are these people

  1. retirement

  2. twenties

  3. middle-aged

  4. thirties

  5. senior

Are these

  1. true
  2. true
  3. No,Because they had lots of fights(arguments)
  4. true

Connect

1→e

2→c

3→a

4→f

5→d

6→g

7→b

Personal questions

A1: I am in mine middle twenties, It’s an awkward age,Because I have to solve lots of difficult problems in the life ,and withstand pressure or curious from parents.

A2: I started to learn a new music instrument , made a personal website and keep on studying internet knowledges , I hope to have more opportunities and challenges that make me a lot of money in the future.
entry.summary:
Conversation

A1: I’m 25 years old

A2

entry.content:
I started renew an old project that made me feel a little tired

The weather was very cold ,I have to wear the down jacket

I like rainning day ,because I like to sleep in the rainning day.

smart,lazy,responable

Vocabulary

invite

Jane invited me to attend her birthday tomorrow, but I have to work overtime.

territory

The lord has a large territory more than i imagined

neighbourhood

she lived in a wealthy neighbourhood in London

military base

The military base is a mysterious place, you can’t go there alone.

established

This program was established in China in 1970

cherry

The little girl was fond of the cherry sugar that gave her a sweet tooth

we singing songs around the house to celebrate the new year is a tradition around here

Especially

I love music very much ,especially rock music.

specially

the hospital prepared a specially room for the woman

Questions

A1: Yes,I do,I often invite my friends to my house for a meal ,Because my roommate likes cooking,especially roast chicken and fish.

A2: Because her husband and children love to eat

A3: If you say that something comes with the territory, you mean that you accept it as a natural result of the situation you are in.

As a doctor, Tom has to work long hours and some weekends, but that comes with the territory I suppose.

A4: It’s near the schools,the hospital,and her husband’s office.

A5: beacuse she lives near the airport ,at the night,the traffic is busy on the road in front of their house.

Brainstorm

  1. The house is near the airport or railway
  2. No public facilities and buildings suitable for people’s lives
  3. Air pollution around the house

  4. The house is far from the city center and friends

  5. near the city center,and convenient for life

  6. the house is near a beautiful park that you can take some exercise every day
entry.summary:
I started renew an old project that made me feel a little tired

The weather was very cold ,I have to wear the down jacket

I

entry.content:
Discussion

A1: Including me, there are three people

A2: No,I’m not,My friend likes to clean house

A3: No,I often use public transport to go to work.

Vocabulary

routine

They are in charge of routine work for the company.

convey

My boss asked me how long need convey those goods to the storage

menial

Jane feels very bored and tired when her boss give her a lot of menial task

errand

I have do do many errand in my leisure time

goodwill

Tom is a goodwill man who often helps people when they need help.

Activity

A person who is pulling a garbage can / take out the tarsh

airing clothes

take laundry

mop the floor

Having mown the lawn

Wash dishes

Chores

It was a chore to sweep the floor,It was really awful.

Errands

buying beautiful clother the shop ia an errand.

Discussion

A1: our product manager. they has to do many menial task,such as deal with a lots of repeat problems with our foreign customer and working together with all sort of engineers to solve many problems or develop the product future.

A2: Yes,I have, I feel not good but It also made me realize that I will never be that kind of person.

Practice

  1. favors
  2. chores
  3. favors
  4. chores
  5. chores
  6. chores
  7. chores

entry.content:
Teamwork With Conjunctions

list

@You can give me a list contains what you want gifts

uncertain

We should not talk to anyone about uncertain things.

solution

we must find out a solution to solve those problems

substitute

You should not eat meat substitute for vegetables ,It’s not healthy

Introduction

A1: I like to work in a group,Because my group often share interesting things with me that give me more fun, and also teach me lots of important skills about work.

Conjunctions

Sara often start dress up herself at 7:00 , and eat breakfast at 8:00

Jane is a smart ,tall and attractive woman.

I like to eat grape but I don’t like to drink grape juice.

You can choose a beautiful tie or brooch to suit your new clothes.

Tom resigned last Friday, so he has enough time to do what he wants to do.

she’d never been swimming nor had her friends

I have received neither an acknowledgment nor a reply.

when the festival is coming , many people will buy gifts ,so the money is reduce yet again

We have yet to decide what action to take

Practice

  1. and

  2. but

  3. but

  4. or

  5. nor

    Discussion

    A1: When we work in a group, we should develop a plan for how to start the project and prepare more details about the project prototype. Finally, we must give the final completion time of the project. If the time is delayed, we need to find out the reason.
entry.summary: Teamwork

entry.content:
Family Holidays

USED TO AND WOULD

Discussion

A1:

My mother often prepared a lot of delicious foods and my sister with me used to Play all kinds of games with snow in a good weather day.

A2:

Yes,I have ,In fact,I love snow very much,snow represents every beautiful things in my heart.

A3:

I prefer winter,because I love snow and I dislike hot weather despite we can stay a room with an Air condition all day

Discussion

A1:

We would play hide and seek in the house

A2: I would prepare a good environment to play game

A3: pop music

A4: I used to have a little duck,It was sick and dead

A5: I was afraid for going to school when I was a child, because our teachers used to give students a lot of homework.
entry.summary: Family Holidays

Forget Words

A

B

C

Competent

As a competent teacher,She knowns perfectly the merits and shortcomings of her students

Creep

Amy crept out of the room in order not to wake up her husband

D

Damp

These damp matches won’t strike.

Delegation

The delegation ended their visit to China on March30.

Defect

The child was born with a heart defect

Dwelling

The new housing policy will provide 10,000 affordable dwellings for needy people in the district

F

Flavour

Onions smell so awful that I can nerver stand the flavour of them.

Fountain

Men and women have their respective roles in their society and there should not be any bias against either of them

Robe

Scrape

Jane scraped the mud off herboots before getting into the room

entry.summary: Forget Words

entry.content:
What are you doing?

Warm-Up

A1: @No,I don’t, Because he neglected his duties and made our project endtime always to be put off that let our team often work overtime

Vocabulary

marketing: promoting,advertising

​ @Marketing goods to customers is not easy when you first start to be a seller

from scratch: from the begining,initial.

​ @Tom gave up his first job ,Now he needs to find a new job from scratch

expersize: special skill in a subject or field.

​ @A Good developers must have excellent expertise and project skills

recruit: to find new people to work in a company.

​ @Our company has recruited several trainee who graduated from college

recruitment: the act or process of recruiting.

​ @Recruitment is a long process that often wastes Interviewers a lot of time to choose the right people

essential: important and necessary.

​ @Essential manners is important to promote our social relationship

rigid : hard to change ,very strict.

​ @Jane is a head rigid woman.

downsize : reduce the number of people to reduce the costs.

​ @Downsize a factory usually means firing some people.

Pin down : to force someone to make decision about something.

​ @Pin down a project prototype and design is a first important thing.

Headhunters : someone who finds the best persion for a job and convines the persion to leave their original company.

​ @Headhunters are very busy all year round .

Language Focus

Q: What am I/are you/is she/is he/are we/are they doing?

A: I’m /You’re/She’s/He’s/We’re/They’re fooling around.

Practice Time

walk the dog

chat online

to make/give a presentation

prepare for a meeting

take a nap

Conversation: Headhunting

be meeting with sb

talking about sb

interested in sth

Free Talk

A1: @Yes,I would,Because it’s a great chance to me and it also can make me earn more money.

A2: @He should have an ability to withstand very large pressure and good management experience.

Recap

If a sysyem is very strict and hard to change,It’s a regid system.

In order to reduce costs, a company needs to reduce the number of people,Then the company is downsizing.

Headhunters is someone who finds the best people for a job.

If you don’t have your own expertise ,It’s hard to compete with others.

Remark

@ means the sentence not checking by teacher
entry.summary: What are you doing?

entry.content:
Essential Grammer in Use

UNIT 1-2. am/is/are

A

My name is Lisa,I’m American.I’m from Chicago.I’m a student.My father is doctor and my mother is a journalist.

I’m 22.I’m not married.My favorite colour is blue.My favorite sports are football and swimming.I ‘m interested in art.

B

PositiveNegative
I am (I’m)I am not (I’m not)
he/she/it is (he’s/she’s/it’s)he/she/it is not (he’s/she’s/it’s not) (he/she/it isn’t)
we/they/you are (we’re they’re you’re)we/they/you are not(we’re/they’re/you’re not) (we/they/you aren’t)
that/there/here is(that’s/there’s/here’s)

A

PositiveNegative
I amam I ?
he/she/it isis he/she/it ?
we/they/you areare we/they/you ?
  • ‘Am I late ?’ ‘No,you’re on time.’
  • ‘Is your mother at home?’ ‘No,She’s out.’
  • ‘Are your parents at home?’ ‘No,They’re out.’
  • Your shoes are nice.Are they new?

B:

Where is(Where ‘s) What is(What’s) Who is(Who’s) How is(How’s) Why is(Why’s)

  • Where is your mother? Is she at home?

  • ‘What colour is your car?’ ‘It’s red.’

  • How are your parents? Are they well?

  • ‘How much are these postcards?’ ‘Fifty pence.’

  • ‘How old is Joe?’ ‘He’s 24.’

C:

short answers

PositiveNegative
Yes,I amNo,I’m not.
Yes,he/she/it isNo, he/she/it’s not or he/she/it isn’t
Yes,we/they/you areNo, we/they/you’re not or we/they/you aren’t
  • ‘Are you tired?’ ‘Yes,I am.’
  • ‘Is your friend English?’ ‘Yes,he is.’
  • ‘That’s my seat.’ ‘No,it isn’t.’

UNIT 3-4. I am doing&are you doing?

Present continuous

A

  • She’s eating.(== she isn’t reading.)
  • It’s raining. (==The sun isn’t shining.)
  • They’re running.(==They aren’t walking.)

The present continuous is:

am/is/are + doing/eating/running/writing etc.

B

am/is/are + _ing = something is happening now.

  • Looking at Sue!She’s wearing her new hat.(=She is wearing it now)
  • The weather is nice at the moment. It’s not rainning.
  • (on the phone)We’re having dinner now.Can you phone again later?
  • You can turn off the television.I’m not watching it.

Spellingcome -> coming write -> writing dance -> dancingrun -> running sit -> sitting swim -> swimminglie -> lying

A

Present continuous questions

  • ‘Are you feeling OK?’ ‘Yes,I’m fine,thank you.’
  • ‘Is it raining?’ ‘Yes, take an umbrella.’
  • Who are you waiting for?Are you waiting for Sue?

B

is/are + subject + -ing

  • Is he working today?
  • Is Paul working today?
  • Where are they going?

C

  • ‘Are your friends staying at a school?’ ‘No,they aren’t.They’re staying with me’

UNIT 5-6. I do work like & I don’t…

A

They read / he likes /I work etc = the present simple

I/we/you/theyreadlikeworklivewatchdohave
he/she/itreadslikesworksliveswatchesdoeshas

  • They’re looking at their books.(== They are read a lot.)

  • He’s eating an ice-cream.(==He likes ice-cream.)

  • I work in a shop,My brother works in a bank.

  • Linda lives in London.Her parents live in Scotland.

  • John has a shower every day.

    Spelling (→Appendix 5):

    -es after -s / -sh / -ch : pass → passes finish → finishes watch → watches

-y → -ies : study → studies try → tries

also: do → does go → goes

B

We use the present simple for things that are true in general, or for things that happen sometimes or all the times

  • I like big cities.
  • The shops open at 9 o’clock and close 5.30.
  • Tim works very hard.He starts at 7.30 and finishes at 8 o’clock in the evening.
  • The Earth goes around the Sun.
  • We do a lot of different things in our free time.
  • It costs a lot of money to stay at luxury hotels.

C

always/never/often/sometimes/usually + present simple

  • Sue always arrives at work early.
  • I usually go to work by car but sometimes I walk.
  • Julia never eats breakfast.
  • Tom lives near us. We often see him.

A

Present simple negitive

positivenetitive
I/we/you/theywork/like/do/haveI/we/you/theydo not(don’t)
he/she/itworks/likes/does/hashe/she/itdoes not(doesn’t)

  • She donesn’t drink coffee.

  • He donesn’t like his job.

  • I drink coffee but I don’t drink tea.

  • Sue drinks coffee but she doesn’t drinks tea.

  • Sometimes he is late but it doesn’t happen very often

B

I/we/you/they don’the/she/it donesn’t

  • I don’t like Fred and Fred doesn’t like me.
  • My car doesn’t use much petrol.
  • Sometimes he is late but it doesn’t happen very often.

C

We use don’t/doesn’t + infinitive(don’t like / doesn’t speak / doesn’t do etc.):

  • I don’t like washing the car. I don’t do it very often.
  • Sandra speaks Spanish but she doesn’t speak Italian.
  • Bill doesn’t do his job very vell.
  • Paula doesn’t usually have breakfast.

UNIT 7. Do you …?

B

Study the word order:

do/does + suject + infinitive

do/doessujectinfinitive
Doyouworkin the evening?
Doyour friendslivenear here?
DoesChrisplaytennis?
wheredoyour parentslive?
How oftendoyouwashyour hair?
Whatdoesthis wordmean?
How muchdoesitcostto fly to Rome?

Questions with always/usually/often:

| —- | ——– | ———— | —————— | ———- | —————————– ||| Do | you | always | have | breakfast?|||Does |Chris|often|play|tennis?|| What |do |you|usually|do|at weekends? |​

C

do I/we/you/they
does he/she/it

  • Do you like music?
  • Does he like music?​

    D

    short answers
positivenetitive
Yes,I /we/you/they do.No,I /we/you/they don’t.
Yes,he/she/it does.No,he/she/it doesn’t.
  • ‘Do you play tennis?’ ‘No,I don’t.’
  • ‘Do you parents speak English?’ ‘Yes,They do.’
  • ‘Does Georage work hard?’ ‘Yes,he does.’
  • ‘Does your sister live in London?’ ‘No,she doesn’t.’

UNIT 8. I am doing and I do

A

Jim is watching television.

He is not playing the guitar.

But Jim has a guitar.

He often plays it and he plays very well.

Jim plays the guitar.

But he is not playing the guitar now.

Is he playing the guitar? No,he isn’t (present continuous)

Does he play the guitar? Yes,he does. (present simple)

B

Present continuous (I am doing) - now,at the time of speaking:​ I’m doingpast ———————————— Now ————————————-future

  • Please be quite.I’m working.
  • Tom is having a shower at the moment.
  • Take an umbrella with you, It’s rainning.
  • Why are under the table? What are you doing?

C

Present(I do) - in general,all the time or sometimes:​ I dopast ———————————— Now ————————————-future

  • I work every day from 9 o’clock to 5.30.
  • Tom has a shower every morning.
  • It rains a lot in winter.
  • What do you usually do at the weekend?

D

We do not use these verbs in the present continuous(I am -ing)

like love want know understand remember dependprefer hate need mean belive forget

Use the present simple only with these verbs(I want / do you like?etc)

  • I’m tired.I want to go home.
  • ‘Do you know that girl?’ ‘Yes,but I don’t remember her name.’
  • I don’t understand.What do you mean?

UNIT 9. I have …/I’ve got

A

You can say I have or I’ve got,he has or he’s got:

I/we/you/they haveI/we/you/they have got (I/we/you/they’ve got)
he/she/it hashe/she/it has got ( he/she/it’s got)
  • I’ve got blue eyes.(or I have blue eyes.)
  • Time has got two sisters.(or Tim has two sisters.)
  • They like animals.They’ve got a horse,three dogs and six cats.

B

I haven’t got / have you got? etc

negativequestionshort answers
I/we/you/they have not (haven’t) gothave I/we/you/they got ?Yes,I/we/you/they have
he/she/it has not (hasn’t) gothas he/she/it has got ?Yes, he/she/it has

C

I don’t have / do you have? etcIn negatives and questions you can also use do/does…:

  • They don’t have any children.(= They don’t have got any children.)
  • It’s a nice house but it doesn’t have a garden.(= It hasn’t got a gardren.)
  • Does Ann have a car?(= Does Ann have got a car?)
  • How much money do you have?(= How much money have you got?)

UNIT 10. was/were

A

am/is(present) -> was(past)

  • I am tired.(now) -> I was tired last night.
  • Where is Ann?(now) -> Where was Ann yesterday?
  • The weather is good today. -> The weather was good last week.

are(present) -> were(past)

  • You are last.(now) -> You were late yesterday.
  • They aren’t here(now) -> They weren’t here last Sunday.

B

positivenegativequestion
I/he/she/it wasI/he/she/it was not(wasn’t)was I/he/she/it ?
we/you/they werewe/you/they were not(weren’t)were we/you/they?
  • Last year Rachel was 22,so she is 23 now.
  • When I was a child,I was afraid of dogs.
  • We were hungry after the journey but we weren’t tired.

  • The hotel was comfortable but it wasn’t expensive.

  • Was the weather goos when you were on holidat?

  • Those shoes are nice.Were they exensive?
  • Why were you late this morning?

C

short answers

| ——————————– | ————————————————- ||Yes, I/he/she/it was |No, I/he/she/it was not(wasn’t) || Yes,we/you/they were |No, we/you/they were not(weren’t) |

  • ‘Were you late?’ ‘No,I wasn’t.’
  • ‘Was Ted at work yesterday?’ ‘Yes,he was.’
  • ‘Were Sue and Steve at the party?’ ‘No,they weren’t.’
entry.summary: Essential Gram

entry.content:
American Football

Vocabulary

opponent: someone who you try to defeat in a competition,game,fight, or argument

​ @ Jane is a good opponent with great professional ability.

injure: to hurt yourself or someone else,for example in an accident or an attack

​ @ Tom found an injured woman on the road.

promote: to help something to develop or increase

​ @ Amy often share delicious food with me that promote our relationship.

stunt: a dangeous action that is done to entertain people, especially in a film.

​ @ If you want to good at a stunt, you must practice day to day.

flexible: able to send easily.

​ @ Monkeys have flexible bodies, so they are easy to climb trees.

History

be derived from sth

changed into sth by sb

studied at sp(some places)

be considered to do sth

Objective

be done by sth

attact to do sth

defend to do sth from sth

Equipment

In order to do sth

be avaiable to do sth

A1: Yes, When playing a volleyball , I threw a power ball hit my opponent in the face and hurt him.

College Football

be possiable to do sth

allow sb to do sth

Cheerleaders

come onto sp to do sth

A1: @No, I like to watch them dancing

Fans

sb get dressed up in sc(some clothes) to do sth

Dialogue

give sth to sb as a bonus

Matching

a -> 6 Cheerleaders: young ladies who dance with pompoms on the field

b -> 3 College: the place where you study after high school

c -> 1 Helmet: a piece of equipment worn on the head

d -> 2 England: the place where rugby was first played

e -> 4 Paint: a substance which football fans put on their bodies.

f -> 5 Walter Camp: the “Father of American Football”

Grammar

Infinitive verb has the wold “to” before the verb,but a base verb does not.

Infinitive verb

I am going to sleep in five minutes

Football coaches like to give advice and tips to players

If I don’t eat something now

Base verb

A quaterback must throw the ball accurately

It looks like it is going to rain at any moment (verb: going)

Both(Infinitive verb + Base verb)

They went to the supermarket to buy some meat

Wrap-UP

A1: No, I don’t like dangerous sports.

A3: @ It may promote children’s growing and also let them understand about what’s the team mean

Remark

@ means the sentence not checking by teacher
entry.summary: American Football

entry.title: 科学上网相关指南
entry.content:
科学上网相关指南

1. 搬瓦工相关问题

搬瓦工换IP

搬瓦工 VPS 由于“high CPU usage”被暂停的原因和解决方法

1. Camera

  1. 使用Camera2的时候, 清单配置文件需要增加允许手机开启硬件加速考虑到现有国内厂家对Camera2的支持度一般,不建议在实际开发项目中使用此API,略坑

entry.title: Android机型Bug
entry.content:
1. Samsung

Q1: 拍照后会照片自动旋转

Phone: Samsung SM-N9008S Android 5.0

S1: 三星拍照旋转问题

2. OPPO

Q1: startForeground通知栏不显示

Phone: OPPO R9m Android5.1,OPPO R9s Android5.1

S1: OPPO手机对新apk默认的通知栏显示是关闭,参考解决: 

1. 先打开通知栏开关,再打开应用2. 将应用切换后台后,可以考虑监听,不过我觉得没有必要,后台杀死重新打开就好了

3. Allview

Q1: 在罗马尼亚语言下String转一位小数解析数据异常

Phone: Allview X5 Soul Pro

S1: DecimalFormat(“#.#”).format(num.toDouble()) 设备会自动把”.”替换为”,” ,类似”0,4”,可使用其他转换方法

O1: 此问题不局限于此类型手机​

4. 小米

Q1: 自定义相机自拍模式下,画面上下颠倒

Phone: 小米5s

S1: 小米在切换前置镜头的时候,应该将相机设置为270度而不是90度,大多数手机在调用系统的Camera的原生API的时候,如果出现上下颠倒现象,请检查角度是否设置正确

5. 索尼手机

Q1: Edittext设置超出显示长度范围的内容后不显示

Phone:

S1: 截取到最大显示长度之前的来显示

6. 华为荣耀

Q1: 无前置摄像头

Phone: 荣耀7i

S1: 不显示可切换至前置摄像头的按钮
entry.summary: 1. Samsung

entry.title: Android8.0版本新特性
entry.content:
Android8.0

  1. EditText新增自动记忆功能

    A1: 其他EditText的id需要与此类型的EditText的id不能一致,否则会默认弹出其他同一id的密码框内容填充

Android8.1

  1. String.getBytes(“Unicode”)(Google手机8.1系统)

    在版本8.1之前，返回的byte[] 是低位在前，高位在后，8.1后直接变成了高位在前，低 位在后

    A1: 改成String.getBytes(“UnicodeLittleUnmarked”)

    注意：

    原来的getBytes(“Unicode”)默认前两个字节分别是-2，-1.

    而getBytes(“UnicodeLittleUnmarked”)去除了这两个字节。

  2. 应用的通知栏正常使用需要在通知管理里找到应用,并打开channel one

Android9.0

  1. 当应用使用了前台服务时, 清单配置文件增加一条新权限

    uses-permission android:name=”android.permission.FOREGROUND_SERVICE”

    否则程序无法正常安装

  2. 针对http请求,需要在清单配置文件里的application需要增加一条设置

    android:usesCleartextTraffic=”true”

    否则抛出异常 java.net.UnknownServiceException: CLEARTEXT communication to not permitted by network security policy

    原因是Google现在推荐使用https,所以http是不安全且未来将会被弃用的.
entry.summary: Android8.0

entry.title: Sqlite数据库多表联合查询
entry.content:
前言

工作上用数据库存储文件还是很便利的，所以有时候发现一张表存储数据感觉数据结构不是很清晰的时候，就需要新加第二张表或者多张表来进行联合查询对象信，一般是用键将彼此联系起来，在表中，每个主键的值都是唯一的。这样做的目的是在不重复每个表中的所有数据的情况下，把表间的数据交叉捆绑在一起，下面，写一点简单的例子

先说一下两张表各自要展现的内容有哪些

  • 第一张表是动物的种类信息，有猫、狗、鸟三种，表名：animal
  • 第二张表是一种动物的具体种类，猫有波斯猫（persian）、 伯曼猫（birman）、布偶猫 （ragdoll）；狗有维兹拉犬（vizsla）、波利犬（puli）、蝴蝶犬（papillon）；鸟有杜鹃鸟（cuckoo）、布谷鸟（eagle ）、鹰（Egret），表名：classify。
  • 两张表的联系是有相同的anim_id ，请留意，”anim_id” 列把上面的两个表联系了起来

表结构类型如下:

第一张表

animal_idanim_name
1cat
2dog
3bird

第二张表

classify_idanimal_iddetailed_nameage
11persian1
21birman2
31ragdoll5
42vizsla3
52puli8
62papillon1
73cuckoo4
83eagle2
93papillon3

下面查询种类为猫的都有哪些详细种类，这些猫的年龄有多大

SQL语句:

然后得到的表结果如下：

anim_namedetailed_nameage
catpersian1
catbirman2
catragdoll5

这是查询一种种类下的具体的动物详细分类，大多时候用表联合查询是用来筛除一些脏数据信息的，现在我们将表2添加一些其他数据，比如山羊(goat)的信息，但是表1不变

修改后的第二张表

classify_idanimal_iddetailed_nameage
11persian1
21birman2
31ragdoll5
42vizsla3
52puli8
62papillon1
73cuckoo4
83eagle2
93papillon3
104goat1

现在根据表1的主键来查询表2的信息，具体说来就是,都有什么动物种类，这些对应的动物种类下都有什么详细分类

这个时候的sql语句

然后得到的表结果如下：

classify_idanimal_iddetailed_nameage
11persian1
21birman2
31ragdoll5
42vizsla3
52puli8
62papillon1
73cuckoo4
83eagle2
93papillon3

其实也就是我们之前未进行修改的表2的数据，如果两个表共有的animal_id不进行指定的话，数据库就会自己去匹配两个表中相同的字段值，具体的情况要进行具体的分析，这里只给出了一种参考，具体的代码操作，还需要自己去写，也是比较简单的

更多的多表查询请移步:http://www.w3school.com.cn/sql/index.asp

最后

以上是我的理解,有什么不对的,欢迎留言指正,谢谢
entry.summary:
前言

工作上用数据库存储文件还是很便利的，所以有时候发现一张表存储数据感觉数据结构不是很清晰的时候，就需要新加第二张表或者多张表来
